ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: By taking this class, I learned how to become a more visual learner. I feel more emphatic of deaf culture and peoples differences around me.
I learned more ASL vocabulary, as well as aspects of Deaf culture. Storytelling was a big focus of this semester, and I learned how to express myself more clearly in ASL.
I learned more about ASL and the Deaf community.
I learned much about Deaf Culture in ASL 120, along with storytelling and more vocabulary.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The structure and level of difficulty of this course differs between the professors. After later discussing with students in other sections, I noticed that under my professor, the assessments, lectures, final project presentation, and grading were drastically different. Assessments: short answer vs multiple choice. (1) homework was often new material instead of review, meaning it took much longer to complete. (2) quiz and midterm format were different (short answer vs multiple choice). (3) our section did not receive an interpreter when others did for service project presentation. (4) grading was much harsher and never clearly explained.
Honestly, this class was great but I heard that our teacher was harder than most other ones

The ASL sequence is very fun. There are always events going on around campus that help me sharpen my ASL skills. There's generally a lot of room for engagement even outside the classroom. Something that could be improved is the deadlines being assigned by day rather than all at the end of the week.
It was an excellent course. Great at building community involvement.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course with a different professor.
Yes! However it is very hard to get into.
Yes very good language to take. Faculty is great.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. Learning ASL was truly a transformative experience and it can benefit everyone interested in Deaf language or culture.
Absolutely. I had a fantastic time and learned a bunch.
I would. I love learning ASL, and having knowledge of the language helps promote inclusivity.
